abstracts.cdata!:
This is a Project completion report
            (PCR) of the Algeria Bas Cheliff Irrigation Project. The
            Project was the third cooperative effort by the Government
            of Algeria and the Bank to work in the agricultural sector
            and the first effort in the irrigation sub-sector. It was
            considered by the two parties as the preliminary phase for
            an anticipated wider Bank involvement in the irrigation
            sub-sector. Its objectives were to safeguard the
            continuation of irrigated agriculture in the Bas Cheliff
            district, to improve operation and maintenance of the
            existing systems, and to determine, through studies, the
            most viable follow-up irrigation development program in Bas
            Cheliff. At appraisal, the Project was intended to provide
            for rehabilitation of the irrigation head works by the
            replacement or repair of the head reach and main canal
            structures and the hydromechanical and electromechanical
            equipment, the purchase of operation and maintenance
            (O&M) equipment and the preparation of studies for
            follow-up irrigation development in Bas Cheliff.

18210061.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is the first stage of an
            eventual three-stage effort to assist the Government in
            rehabilitating old and badly damaged irrigation
            infrastructure, reclaiming lands lost to salinity and
            rationalizing and developing irrigated agriculture in the
            Bas Cheliff district. The proposed project would focus on
            the most urgently needed civil works to ensure the
            continuation of irrigated agriculture on some 4,000 ha in
            the district, and on measures to improve operations and
            strengthen maintenance. Studies are included for the
            preparation of second- and third-stage project which would
            emphasize respectively: (i) improvements in irrigated
            agricultural production and reclamation works for some
            10,000 ha, and (ii) the construction of water mobilization
            works and extension of the irrigation network. The project
            would consist of: (i) the repair of diversion weir, the main
            and primary canals, sluice gates, pumping stations and an
            aqueduct; (ii) the reconstruction of part of the primary
            canal and three aqueducts, the replacement of several sluice
            and automatic gates and pumping station equipment and the
            provision of a power supply line; (iii) purchase of
            maintenance and transport equipment; and (iv) the provision
            of technical assistance and studies,most of which relate to
            the prep
